Hauk.Action: Responds promptly to a report of a small jet in trouble over restricted airspace and immediately inquires about its location.
Walks confidently into the air traffic room, a high-pressure environment with many operators, indicating familiarity and command.
Pulls Rehme aside to quietly inquire about the unknown code, showing concern and focus on the situation.
Shares a look of shock with Rehme upon discovering the code is Air Force One, indicating shared concern and sincerity in the moment.
Quickly investigates the unidentified code 'David 14' and follows up with Rehme to verify its authenticity, showing alertness and initiative.
Responds promptly to the emergency situation by coordinating with Rehme and the controller, demonstrating situational awareness and decisiveness.
Shows shock and surprise upon discovering the code corresponds to Air Force One, indicating a momentary lapse in anticipating the severity of the situation.
Volunteers to go into the dangerous area to retrieve the escape pod.
Hangs back while policemen run out ahead.
Observes computer simulation and quickly decides to go in after the pod.
Communicates clearly and confidently over radio while moving down toward target.
Hangs back when policemen run out after helicopter landing, showing caution and situational awareness.
Negotiates calmly with Weirdo to avoid immediate violence and tries to de-escalate the situation.
Refuses to rush into a dangerous assault that could endanger the hostage, showing concern for human life.
Waves off Rehme's insistence to act immediately, indicating trust in his own judgment and caution.
Arms himself quietly and confidently, showing readiness but no aggression or hostility.
Examines the pod carefully and assesses the situation before acting.
Negotiates calmly with Weirdo under pressure, buying time and avoiding rash decisions.
Refuses to rush into a dangerous rescue operation without a clear plan, showing strategic thinking.
Confidently arms himself and acknowledges the danger with calm assurance.
Waves off Rehme's insistence to act immediately, demonstrating confidence in his judgment.
Offers Snake Plissken a deal promising full pardon for his crimes if he rescues the President.
Refuses to remove Snake's handcuffs despite his silent request.
Speaks firmly and somewhat condescendingly to Snake, calling him 'War Hero' sarcastically.
Reads Snake's file thoroughly, demonstrating knowledge of his background and military record.
Offers Snake a clear, high-stakes deal with a defined objective and reward, showing strategic thinking.
Maintains control of the conversation initially, pressing his advantage by revealing critical information about the President's crash.
Fails to anticipate Snake's calm and dismissive attitude, allowing Snake to regain conversational control.
Makes a straightforward offer to Snake and insists on the importance of the mission, showing trust in Snake's abilities.
Pushes Snake too hard for an immediate answer, showing impatience and pressure.
Acknowledges Snake's skills and admits he has no other options, indicating some respect and sincerity.
Explains the tracer and safety catch clearly to Snake, providing useful information.
Hands Snake a homing device to help locate the President, showing trust and support.
Offers Snake a strong antitoxin injection to protect him, demonstrating care for his wellbeing.
Attempts to assert authority over Snake, but Snake resists; Hauk does not escalate or show hostility.
Explains the tracer bracelet and its safety catch clearly and confidently.
Provides detailed, practical information about the landing spot and infiltration route.
Hands Snake a homing device and explains its use effectively.
Administers or oversees the administration of a strong antitoxin and uses a timer gauge to monitor its effect.
Attempts to assert authority over Snake but fails to command respect.
Explains the mission details clearly and honestly to Snake, including the timer and the consequences of failure.
Shows impatience and a bit of condescension toward Snake, implying Snake doesn't care about the survival of the human race.
Takes responsibility for the dangerous capsules implanted in Snake, admitting it was his idea.
Straps a timer gauge onto Snake's hand and sets a precise countdown based on the mission deadline.
Explains the critical mission details clearly and confidently, showing understanding of the stakes involved.
Uses a medical procedure to inject Snake with microscopic capsules as a timed threat to ensure compliance.
Underestimates Snake's reaction to the capsules, leading to Snake grabbing him by the throat.
Dismisses Snake's idea to turn the Gullfire around and fly off, showing strategic judgment.
Tells Snake 'Get them both back, Plissken.'
Warns Snake 'Remember, once inside you're on your own.' and denies support.
Provides clear instructions about neutralizing the charges with X-rays and the timing involved.
Confidently asserts that charges will be burned out if Snake has the President, showing understanding of the mission parameters.
Exchanges a knowing glance with Rehme when Snake questions the plan, indicating anticipation and preparedness.
Tells Snake he is on his own once inside, refusing to offer support, which could be seen as either realistic or unsupportive but shows clear boundaries.
Monitors Snake's life clock carefully, demonstrating attention to detail and situational awareness.
Nods with relief after tracer test confirmation, showing shared concern and support.
Repeatedly checks in with Snake, showing attentiveness and care for his wellbeing.
Gives practical advice about using the east stairwell, demonstrating helpfulness and concern for Snake's safety.
Instructs Snake to use the east stairwell and tells him to call when he gets outside.
Does not react or intervene when Snake puts away the walkie-talkie and continues without noticing someone running past.
Responds promptly to Snake's call and maintains communication during a critical moment.
Fails to immediately identify the real President, relying on faulty life signs and assumptions.
Threatens Plissken with violence if he disobeys orders.
Threatens Plissken with clear, decisive consequences if he disobeys orders.

Sends Snake to rescue the President, indicating trust in Snake's abilities and planning a coordinated extraction.
Does not appear directly in the excerpt, so no direct actions or statements to evaluate.
Monitors surveillance reports carefully and waits with Rehme and the Vice President, showing calm control over the situation.
Does not intervene or take action despite the lack of detected movement and the ongoing danger to Snake, potentially indicating passivity or overreliance on surveillance data.
Insists on holding position and giving orders despite Vice President's override attempt, asserting control over the prison.
Refuses to follow the Vice President's orders, asserting command by stating 'This is my prison, I'll give the orders.'
Engages in a power struggle with the Vice President, confidently challenging 'Just try.' when the VP says he overrides Hauk's orders.
Immediately checks the monitor with Rehme upon hearing the pilot's report, showing alertness and prompt response to new information.
Shows interest and engagement by focusing on the surveillance readout, indicating situational awareness.
Hauk hesitates upon reading the threatening note, showing reluctance about the mission.
Decides to warm up the choppers and move in despite his hesitation, demonstrating responsibility and commitment.
Reads the note left in the briefcase, processes the hostage demand, and promptly orders helicopters to warm up and prepare for a tactical response.
Hesitates briefly when questioned about the missing tape and the reliability of Plissken, showing some uncertainty or reluctance.
Urgently orders the helicopter pilot to get on the radio and keep everyone down to help track Snake.
Shows trust in Plissken's knowledge about the safety catch, implying a degree of respect or belief in him.
Stalls when approached by Rehme, delaying action.
Stalls to buy time before acting on Plissken's tracer.
Immediately orders the head helicopter pilot to get on the radio and keep enemies down.
Monitors Snake's tracer and correctly assesses the situation, knowing the signal only lasts 15 minutes.
Decides to put choppers on standby rather than immediate deployment, showing cautious judgment.
Confidently asserts that only Plissken knew about the safety catch, indicating good knowledge of the situation.
No direct actions or statements by Hauk in this excerpt; he is absent from the scene and does not influence events.
Provides critical information about the timer, explaining that the 15 minutes warning was built in, showing understanding of the situation's timing.
Orders a jeep with a winch to assist the President and Snake quickly, showing concern for their safety.
Communicates clearly to Strombaerden to move to Station 19 to support the operation.
Quickly assesses the situation on the 69th street bridge and orders a jeep with a winch to assist, showing prompt decision-making.
Uses a phone to coordinate reinforcements and communicates clearly with Strombaerden to move to Station 19, demonstrating effective communication and command.
Interrupts the medic to demand the tape from Snake, showing urgency and control but no warmth.
After receiving the tape, allows the medic to return and tend to Snake, showing some consideration for Snake's wellbeing.
Interrupts the medic to demand the tape from Snake, showing decisiveness and control in a tense situation.
Uses the medal pads on Snake's neck to check his status, demonstrating knowledge and procedural skill.
Lets the medic come back only after securing the tape, indicating prioritization and command presence.
Offers Snake a job and suggests they could make a great team, showing willingness to collaborate and trust.
Jokes about Snake killing him, indicating a casual, somewhat friendly rapport.
Approaches Snake with a proposal to work together, showing initiative and strategic thinking.
Does not react aggressively or impulsively when Snake questions if he will be killed, maintaining composure.
